intro: Eutriana humilis, commonly known as the small eutriana, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Eutriana humilis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique botanical appearance.
